FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acid Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Acid malt contains acids from natural lactic acids. Used by German brewers to adjust malt PH without chemicals to adhere to German purity laws. Also enhances the head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acidulated (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used in Germany to lower PH levels without resorting to chemicals. Lowers mash pH levels, lightens color, improves flavor stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted specialty malt used in some English browns, milds and old ales to add color and a biscuit taste. Intense flavor - so limit use. Low diastatic power so must be mashed with well modified malts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Amber colored dry malt extract, for general purpose use. Use in any medium to dark colored beer. Examples: Ales, Marzens, Amber Ale, India Pale Ale

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped amber color liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any Ale. Examples: Amber ale, India Pale Ale, Munich style, Marzen, Bock

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted specialty malt used in some English browns, milds and old ales to add color and a biscuit taste. Intense flavor - so limit use. Low diastatic power so must be mashed with well modified malts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Provides a very strong malt flavor and aroma to your beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Smooth, Intensely Malty COLOR CONTRIBUTION: Rich Golden Hues CHARACTERISTICS AND APPLICATIONS Munich-style malt that will contribute an intensely malty flavor and aroma. Use in any beer style for additional maltiness.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Aromatic (Amber 50)(17°-21° L) Dingemans Aromatic is a mildly kilned malt that will add a strong malt aroma and deep color when used as a specialty malt.This malt can make up to 100% of the grain bill, but it is fairly low in surplus diastatic enzymes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley Hulls
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Hulls are introduced to improve the speed of lautering when making high gravity or high adjunct beers. Hulls are neutral in flavor, body and color, and are inert Good for wheat beers, Wits, and others that have high protein mashes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds significant body to Porters and Stouts. High haze producing protein prevents use in light beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Flaked (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use at 10-25% to produce a light colored, mild flavored, dry beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Raw
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Raw, unmalted barley can be used to add body to your beer. Use in homebrew requires very fine milling combined with a decoction or multi-stage mash. Performs best when used in small quantities with well modified grains.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Torrefied
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Raw barley that has been "popped" open to open kernels Used in place of raw barley for faster conversion and higher yields. High in haze producing protein

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Biscuit (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Biscuit (Mout Roost 50) (18° - 27° L) This toasted malt will provide a warm bread or biscuit flavor and aroma and will lend a garnet-brown color. Use 5-15% maximum. No enzymes. Must be mashed with malts having surplus diastatic power.
FERMENTABLE.EXTRACT_SUBSTITUTE: ase Malts, Caramel 60L Malt, Munich Malt

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Biscuit Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use for English ales, brown ales and porters. Adds a biscuit like flavor and aroma. Can be used as a substitute for toasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted black barley adds a strong burnt coffee flavor - suitable for stouts and porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black (Patent) Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark color and dry roasted flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters Use for: Coloring in small amounts, or flavoring of Stouts and Porters in larger amounts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Barley (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Coffee, Intense Bitter, Dry COLOR: Deep Brown provides color and rich, sharp flavor characteristic of Stouts and some Porters a dryness to Stout or Porter. not interchangeable with Black Malt Use 3-7% for a dry Porter Use 5-15% for dry Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Barley (Stout)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unmalted barley roasted at high temperature to create a dry, coffee like flavor. Imparts a sharp acrid flavor characteristic of dry stouts. Gives "dryness" to a stout or porter -- much more so than regular Roasted Barley

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Made by roasting white malt at a higher temperature than that used to produce Chocolate Malts. Sharp flavor and black color, with a smoother flavor than roasted barley. Small percentages add reddish color to Scottish ales, red ales, and bitter. Higher p

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt - 2-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR Neutral CHAR:Use for color adjustment Provides color and sharp, almost acrid, flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters Use 1-10% for desired color in Porter and Stout. has a distinctive malty flavor not interchangeable with Roasted Barley

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Malt - 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR Neutral CHAR:Use for color adjustment Provides color and sharp, almost acrid, flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters Use 1-10% for desired color in Porter and Stout. has a distinctive malty flavor not interchangeable with Roasted Barley

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Borlander Munich Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Smooth Malty and Sweet Color: Golden-Orange Hues Sufficient enzymes for self-conversion Smooth yet pronounced malty flavor plus sweetness Great in Bock beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brewers Malt 2-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Mild Malty Smoother, less grainy flavor than 6-row

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brewers Malt 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Mild Grainy Malty More husk than 2-row, well suited for high adjunct brewing

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Malt (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Brings out a rich coffee flavor that will add complexity to any dark ale.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Sugar, Dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a rich sweet flavor. Used in Scottish ales, holiday ales and some old ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Sugar, Light
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a rich sweet flavor. Used in Scottish ales, holiday ales and some old ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brumalt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark German malt developed to add malt flavor of Alt, Marzen and Oktoberfest beers. Helps create authentic maltiness without having to do a decoction mash. Rarely available for homebrewers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Candi Sugar, Amber
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Candi Sugar, Clear
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Candi Sugar, Dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized Candi Sugar (Sucrose) used in many Belgian Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales. Adds head retention and sweet aroma to beer. Darker variants also add color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cane (Beet) Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Common household baking sugar. Lightens flavor and body of beer. Can contribute a cider-like flavor to the beer if not cold-fermented or used in large quantities.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara 20 (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Cara 20* (19° - 27° L) Dingemans Cara 20 is a light crystal malt used by Belgian breweries in producing Abbey or Trappist style ales and is appropriate for any recipe that calls for crystal malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara 45 (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Cara 45* (40° - 54° L) Dingemans Cara 45 is a medium-amber crystal malt that will impart a rich, caramel-sweet aroma and full flavor, as well as intense color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara 8 (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Cara 8 (6°-9°L)is a very light crystal malt made by drying barley malt at low temperatures.The result is a malt that will lend body, smoother mouth-feel, and foam stability.This malt must be mashed with other kilned malts due to the lack of enzymes.
FERMENTABLE.EXTRACT_SUBSTITUTE: ase Malts, Caramel 60L Malt, Munich Malt

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara-Pils/Dextrine
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Also sold under the names "Dextrine" and "Cara-Foam"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraamber
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraamber (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium colored caramel malt. Bocks, dark ales, red and amber lagers and ales. Improves flavour stability and enhances colour

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraaroma
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very dark crystal malt - similar to a crystal 120 or Caramunich 120 malt. Adds strong caramel flavor, red color, and malty aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraaroma (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very dark caramel malt with aromatic properties. Adds deep red color and aroma. Amber ales, dark lagers, bocks. Substitute for "Belgian Special B" or 120L caramel malts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa I
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to intensify aroma and color in dark, Munich beers and stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa II
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to intensify aroma and color in dark, Munich beers and stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa III
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark color and aroma - used in some German beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocolate malt. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers. Adds color and aroma. De-husked, smoother tasting

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavor. Adds body, color, aroma. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafa Special III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavour. Dark version. Adds color and aroma. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafoam
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Also sold under the names "Dextrine" and "Cara-Pils (TM)"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carafoam (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Carafoam (also called Carapils) adds body and head retention without substantially altering flavor. Up to 10% for light beers, 40% for mashed beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carahell (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light colored caramel malt. Adds body, color and aroma. Use up to 30% in low alcohol beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramalt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Made from green malt - imparts a light malt flavor and slight hue. Suitable for light ales, lagers. Imparts a pale red color, contributes dextrins, and adds to foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 10L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 10L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 120L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Burnt Sugar, Raisiny, Prunes Deep Red Color 3-15% in Amber &Red beers. 10-15% in Bock 7-15% in Dark beers 10-15% in Porter &Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 120L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Burnt Sugar, Raisiny, Prunes Deep Red Color 3-15% in Amber &Red beers. 10-15% in Bock 7-15% in Dark beers 10-15% in Porter &Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 120L Organic (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Burnt Sugar, Raisiny, Prunes Deep Red Color 3-15% in Amber &Red beers. 10-15% in Bock 7-15% in Dark beers 10-15% in Porter &Stout

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 20L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Candy-like Sweetness, Mild Carmel Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 30L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 35L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden Color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 40L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 40L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Caramel, Toffee Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 50L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 60L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Deep Golden to Red color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 60L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Golden to lighr red hues 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 60L Organic (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Sweet, Pronounced Caramel Deep Golden to Red color 3-7% in Pilsener for balance 5-15% for color, sweetness &color to light amber beers CHAR glassy endosperm create desirable non-fermentables giving ability to contrib' body & head retention & stabili

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 80L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune Red to Deep Red 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock beers. 7-15% in Dark beers. 10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Malt - 90L 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune Red to Deep Red 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock beers. 7-15% in Dark beers. 10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Munich 60L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, Roasted, Malty Amber to Red Color Excellent in IPAs, Pale Ales, Oktoberfests and Porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Rye (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel malt made with a rye base. Adds aroma, flavor and color. Used in rye styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Vienne 20L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, Malty Golden Color contributes both mild caramel sweetness and maltiness. Excellent in Vienna-style Lagers and Belgian-style Abbey Ales. Produced from AMBA/BMBRI recommended 2-Row Malting Barley varieties.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel wheat malt - emphasizes wheat malt aroma and adds color to the beer. Popular for Dunkelweizens. Also known as Carawheat -- which is a registered trademark of Wyermann Malting.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 10L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 20L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 30L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 40L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 60L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 80L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt -120L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt. Very Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, flavor, color and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, aroma, color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich III (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German crystal malt. Adds maltiness, body, aroma and color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, copper colored malt. Used in Belgian ales and German bocks.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carapils (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: None COLOR: None ITEM NUMBERS AND PACKAGING OPTIONS adds body, foam retention, and beer stability without influencing color or flavor. non-fermentables to balance body and flavor of dark beers Low usage of 1-5% will help achieve desired resu

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carapils (Briess) Organic
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: None COLOR: None ITEM NUMBERS AND PACKAGING OPTIONS adds body, foam retention, and beer stability without influencing color or flavor. non-fermentables to balance body and flavor of dark beers Low usage of 1-5% will help achieve desired resu

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carapils 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: None COLOR: None ITEM NUMBERS AND PACKAGING OPTIONS adds body, foam retention, and beer stability without influencing color or flavor. non-fermentables to balance body and flavor of dark beers Low usage of 1-5% will help achieve desired resu

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carared
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carared (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Medium crystal malt, adds a body and reddish color. Red ales and lagers, Scottish ales. Full body and aroma, deep red colour

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caravienne Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light Belgian crystal malt. Used in light Trappist and Abbey style Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carawheat (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used in wheat beers and ales. A wheat version of crystal malt. Promotes fuller flavor, wheat malt aroma and enhanced color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Rich Roasted Coffee COLOR: Brown Hues, depending upon usage color adj with minor/no flavor contribution 1-10% for color in Porter &Stout The choc flavor is very complementary when used in higher % in Brown Ales, Porters, Stouts & other Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor. Use for: Brown ales, porters, some stouts Maintains some malty flavor, not as dark as roasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: (300°-380° L)malt is a high-nitrogen malt that is roasted at temps to 450°F and then rapidly cooled when the desired color is achieved."Chocolate"refers primarily to the malt's color,not its flavor.will lend various levels of aroma,a deep red color,and a

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Rich Roasted Coffee COLOR: Brown Hues, depending upon usage color adj with minor/no flavor contribution 1-10% for color in Porter &Stout The choc flavor is very complementary when used in higher % in Brown Ales, Porters, Stouts & other Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Dark 6-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Rich Roasted Coffee COLOR: Brown Hues, depending upon usage color adj with minor/no flavor contribution 1-10% for color in Porter &Stout The choc flavor is very complementary when used in higher % in Brown Ales, Porters, Stouts & other Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor. Use for: Brown ales, porters, some stouts Maintains some malty flavor, not as dark as roasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor. Use for: Brown ales, porters, some stouts Maintains some malty flavor, not as dark as roasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A perfect malt for dark English stout, porter, and brown ales. At small percentages gives a brown color and mild roasted flavor, larger amounts for strong bittersweet chocolate flavor and near black color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Organic (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Rich Roasted Coffee COLOR: Brown Hues, depending upon usage color adj with minor/no flavor contribution 1-10% for color in Porter &Stout The choc flavor is very complementary when used in higher % in Brown Ales, Porters, Stouts & other Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Rye (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted malt made with a rye base. Adds aroma, flavor and color. Used in rye styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Rye Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Primarily used for color and aroma in top-fermented specialty beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Wheat (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Chocholate malt made with a wheat base. Adds aroma and color. Alts and dark wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Intensifies aroma and color in top-fermented beers such as dark wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn - Yellow, Flaked (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: produce a beer with a mild, less malty flavor produce a drier, more crisp beer. APPLICATIONS Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct in the total grist

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn Sugar (Dextrose)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Widely used for bottling at rate of approx 2/3 cup per 5 gallons of beer

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Syrup derived from corn with many of the same properties as corn sugar. May be used to enhance gravity without adding much body or flavor. Limit percentage in batch to avoid wine/cider flavors.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn Syrup - Brewers (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Syrup derived from corn with many of the same properties as corn sugar. May be used to enhance gravity without adding much body or flavor. Limit percentage in batch to avoid wine/cider flavors.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Generally a neutral flavor, used to reduce maltiness of beer Produces beer with a milder, less malty flavor Uses: Primarily for light Bohemian and Pilsner lagers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Dark - 77L (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pronounced Caramel, Slight Burnt Sugar, Raisniny, Prune Red to Deep Red 3-15% in Amber and Red beers. 10-15% in Bock beers. 7-15% in Dark beers. 10-15% in Porter and Stout.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Extra Dark - 120L (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Very Dark

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal Light - 45L (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Dark (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Contributes a strong reddish hue to milds, brown ales, and other dark beers. The long kilning of this malt imparts a roasty edge on top of the malty sweetness of a crystal malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Extra Dark (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very dark English crystal malt with deep amber color and burnt sugar and dark fruit flavors.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Crystal, Medium (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Versatile English crystal malt imparts a rich gold to copper-red color and caramel flavor and increases foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: DME Dark Traditional (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Base Malt, Munich, Caramel 60L, Black Malt Sweet, Intense Malty Use in the production of Red and Amber Beers, Oktoberfest, Bock beer, Doppelbock, brown ales and other dark colored beers. 76% Fermentability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: DME Golden Light (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Base Malt, Briess Carapils® Malt, FLAVOR: Malty All styles of extract beer, and to adjust the color, flavor and gravity of all grain beers. 80% Fermentability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: DME Sparklinf Amber (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Breiss Base Malt, Caramel 60L, Munich Malt FLAVOR: Sweet, Malty, Caramel Use in the production of Pale Ales, Red and Amber Ales, Munich Style Beers, Bock and Oktoberfest Beers, Scottish Ales, and darker beers including Stouts and Porters 80% Fermenta

FERMENTABLE.NAME: DME Wheat Bavarian (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Wheat Malt, Briess Base Malt FLAVOR: Neutral, Malty All wheat beers, & to adj flavor of other styles Use in the production of extract wheat beers, & to adjust the flavor of wheat and other styles of beer 80% Fermentability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark dry extract for general purpose use. Use as base or to increase gravity of any dark ale or lager.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped dark liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any dark beer. Examples: Porter, Brown ale, Bock, Oktoberfest, Stouts

FERMENTABLE.NAME: De-Bittered Black Malt (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: De-Bittered Black Malt (Mout Roost 1400) (500° - 600° L) Using an exclusive evaporative process, Dingemans De-Bittered Black Malt will contribute the same color characteristics as Black malt with a less astringent flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dememera Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark, unrefined brown sugar that contains molasses and other dark impurities. Great for brown ales and porters. Adds slight sweetness and smooth character.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dextrose (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Colorless and sweet 99% fermentable

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Extra Light Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very light color dry malt extract for general purpose use. Use as base or to increase gravity of any ale or lager.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Extra Special (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Burnt Sugar, Woody, Prunes COLOR:Deep Red to Copper Color CHARACTERISTICS:Provides distinctive flavors associated with darker, high gravity beers like Doppelbock. Can be used to enhance standard or lighter gravity provide richer flavor profile.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Golden Promise (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Great base malt that produces a sweet and clean wort. An integral ingredient in Scottish ales and lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Grits
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a corn or grain taste. Mash required. Used to increase gravity of American lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Can be used to lighten flavor and body when substituted for malt. Generally limit to 30% when used as an adjunct. Pasturize and add to primary during fermentation. Use up to 100% for meads.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Intensely sweet - adds a sweet malty flavor sometimes associated with honey. Also called Brumalt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Invert Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to increase starting gravity and also as an adjunct for some Belgian and English ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: LME Dark Traditional (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Base Malt, Munich, Caramel 60L, Black Malt Sweet, Intense Malty Use in the production of Red and Amber Beers, Oktoberfest, Bock beer, Doppelbock, brown ales and other dark colored beers. 76% Fermentability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: LME Golden Light (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Base Malt, Briess Carapils® Malt, Water FLAVOR: Malty All styles of extract beer, and to adjust the color, flavor and gravity of all grain beers. 80% Fermentability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: LME Maltoferm Organic (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malt, Water FLAVOR: Malty  All styles of extract beer, and to adjust the color, flavor and gravity of all grain beers. 80% Fermentability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: LME Pilsen Light (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Base Malt, Briess Carapils® Malt, Water FLAVOR: Neutral to subtle Malty All styles of extract beer, and to adjust the color, flavor and gravity of all grain beers. 80% Fermentability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: LME Porter (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Base Malt, Wheat Malt, Caramel 60L, Chocolate Malt, Roasted Barley Sweet Malty, Chocolate 72% Fermentability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: LME Sparkling Amber Liquid (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Base Malts, Caramel 60L Malt, Munich Malt Flavor Sweet, Malty, Caramel Use for Pale Ales, Red and Amber Ales, Munich Style Beers, Bock and Oktoberfest Beers, Scottish Ales, and darker beers including Stouts and Porters 80% Fermentability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: LME Wheat Bavarian (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Briess Wheat Malt, Briess Base Malt FLAVOR: Neutral, Malty All wheat beers, & to adj flavor of other styles Use in the production of extract wheat beers, & to adjust the flavor of wheat and other styles of beer 80% Fermentability

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Lager Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Very light lager malt used to make Pilsners, Lagers and other light beers. May be used as a base malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Light Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale dry malt extract for general purpose use. Use as base or to increase gravity of any full bodied ale or lager.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Lyle's Golden Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Liquid Invert Sugar. Used to increase alcohol and lighten the beer without alterning flavor. Used in Belgian ales and some English ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Maple Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: If added during the boil it will add a dry, woodsy flavor. If added at bottling, the smooth maple flavor comes through. Used for maple ales, porters, browns.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Maris Otter (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Premium base malt from the UK. Popular for many English styles of beer including ales, pale ales and bitters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoiden Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Aromatic malt from Banberg, Germany. Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoidin (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Red colored malt that improved head retention and stability. Used in red lagers, ales, dark beers. Intense red colour and malty aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Mild Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Also called "English Mild" - a light specialty malt used in Brown Ales

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Mild Malt - Ashburne (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Malty and Sweet COLOR CONTRIBUTION: Rich Golden Hues CHARACTERISTICS AND APPLICATIONS Well suited for mild ale beers for color and maltiness. Imparts smooth sweet flavor while also adding a full malty flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Milk Sugar (Lactose)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Not fully fermentable, so it adds lasting sweetness. Lactose can be added to lend sweetness to Sweet Stouts and Porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Molasses
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a strong, sweet flavor. Used primarily in stouts and porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Munich(4°-7°L)malt undergoes higher kilning temperatures than pale malt.The resulting malt will lend a full, malty flavor and aroma, and an orange-amber color.This malt can make up to 100% of the grain bill, unsuitable to convert adjuncts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich 10L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Robust Malty COLOR: Golden to Orange Hues Adds a pronounced malty flavor without adding non-fermentables or affecting foam. Small amounts added to the grist will improve the malty flavor and give a richer color to low gravity brews.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich 10L Organic (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, Roasted, Malty FLAVOR: Robust Malty COLOR: Golden-Orange Hues CHARACTERISICS AND APPLICATIONS Sufficient enzymes for self-conversion in most mash programs. Provides a smooth yet pronounced malty flavor plus sweetness. Great in bock beers!

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich 20L (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Robust Malty COLOR: Golden to Orange Hues Adds a pronounced malty flavor without adding non-fermentables or affecting foam. Small amounts added to the grist will improve the malty flavor and give a richer color to low gravity brews.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich I (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light Munich malt. May be used as a base for many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks, ales. Enhances malty flavour and aroma

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich II (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Darker Munich Malt. Used as a base malt in many German beer styles. Fest beers, bocks and ales. Enhances malt flavour and aroma

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. Does not contribute signficantly to body or head retention. Use for: Bock, Porter, Marzen, Oktoberfest beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt - 10L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a slight orange color to the beer. Does not contribute signficantly to body or head retention. Use for: Bock, Porter, Marzen, Oktoberfest beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt - 20L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a orange to deep orange color to the beer. Does not contribute signficantly to body or head retention. Use for: Bock, Porter, Marzen, Oktoberfest beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, mouth feel and head retention to the beer Used in oatmeal stouts and porters Adds substantial protein haze to light beers Protein rest recommended unless flakes are pregelatinized

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Flaked (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use at 5-25% to produce a lan Oatmeal Stout Use a small percentage in Belgian Wit Beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Golden Naked (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: This unique product from Simpsons has a special, sweet berry-nut flavor. Used at a rate of 4-15% of total grist by weight, Golden Naked Oats will deliver a deep golden hue with light caramel flavors to the finished beer as well as a creamy, satin finish.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Malted
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted oats. Adds body, mouth feel and head retention to the beer Creates chill haze in lighter beers, so is primarily used in dark ones.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all English beer styles

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale Ale (2.7° - 3.8° L) Dingemans Pale Ale malt is fully modified and is easily converted by a single-temperature mash. This is the preferred malt for ales of all types. This malt is interchangeable with British pale ale malt.
FERMENTABLE.EXTRACT_SUBSTITUTE: ase Malts, Caramel 60L Malt, Munich Malt

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Ale Malt 2-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flavor:Malty Color Golden Hues Can be used as a base malt. More pronounced malty flavor than 2-Row Brewers Malt. Use with 2-Row Brewers Malt for rich malt flavor and additional color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped pale liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any ale or lager.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) Bel
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles Higher potential yield than US, English equivalent pale ale malts

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) UK
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all English beer styles Lower diastatic power than American 2 Row Pale Malt

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) US
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (6 Row) US
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale base malt for all ales and lagers. Good general purpose malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt, Maris Otter
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Premium base malt from the UK. Popular for many English styles of beer including ales, pale ales and bitters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Wheat (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale Wheat (1.2° - 2.0° L) Dingemans Pale Wheat may be used in amounts ranging from 30 - 70% of the total grist to create many styles of wheat beer and in smaller amounts to aid in head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Peat Smoked Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Robust smoky malt that provides a smoky flavor. Used in scottish ales and wee heavy ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Peated Malt (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Ingredient for providing the essential peat flavour in whisky production. Optional for Scottish and Strong Scotch Ales when stronger peat/smoked note is desired. While the malt is in the kiln, peat moss outside the kiln is gently smoked over slow burning

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsen (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsen (1.4° - 1.8° L) Light in color and low in protein, Dingemans Pilsen is produced from the finest European two-row barley. This malt is well modified and can easily be mashed with a single-temperature infusion.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsen Malt 2-Row (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Subtle Malty, Delicately Sweet Very light colored base malt. Produces exceptionally clear, crisp wort. Pilsen Malt has a slightly lower protein level than 2-Row Brewers Malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) Bel
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Belgian base malt for Continental lagers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) Ger
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German base for Pilsners and Bohemian Lagers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) UK
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsner base malt

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsner base malt for all pilsners, lagers. Highly modified malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped pale liquid extract. Use as a base malt for any ale or lager.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice Extract Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used like other rice adjuncts in American and Japenes lagers to provide a dry, clean taste and light body. Adds gravity without changing body or flavor substantially. Use in place of corn sugar in small quantities.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice Hulls
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Hulls are introduced to improve the speed of lautering when making high gravity or high adjunct beers. Hulls are neutral in flavor, body and color, and are inert Good for wheat beers, Wits, and others that have high protein mashes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice Hulls (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Rice Hulls are a filtering aid that improve the speed of vorlauf and lautering. Rice Hulls are particularly effective when brewing high gravity beers with a big grist; beer made with high percentages of specialty malts; and wheat and rye beers. APPLICA

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to add fermentables without increasing body or flavor. Produces a milder, less grainy tasting beer. Examples: American lagers, Bohemian lagers, Pilsners

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice, Flaked (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Barley
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted at high temperature to create a burnt, grainy, coffee like flavor. Imparts a red to deep brown color to beer, and very strong roasted flavor. Use 2-4% in Brown ales to add a nutty flavor, or 3-10% in Porters and Stouts for coffee flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Barley (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Coffee, Intense Bitter COLOR: Red to Deep Brown Use 3-7% for coffee flavor in Porter and Stout Use 2-5% in Nut Brown Ales. Use Chocolate Malt or Black Malt in combination with Roasted Barley to obtain desired color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Barley (Crisp)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Deep roasted barley - adds the dry bitter flavor characteristic of Irish and Imperial Stouts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Barley (Simpsons)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Gives black color with ruby highlights and distinct, astringent roasted bitter flavor. Used for dry Irish stouts. Use very small percentages to add color to Scottish ales and red ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Wheat (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted Wheat (Tarwe Mout Roost 27) (10° - 14° L) Dingemans Roasted Wheat is a slightly roasted wheat that will lend nutty, bread-like flavors.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds a dry, crisp character to the beer. Yields a deep red color, and a distinctive rye flavor Must limit to 10-15% fo the mash as it tends to produce "stuck" mashes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Distinctive Rye, Earthy COLOR: Deep Red Hues Because of its pronounced rye flavor, we using in 5% increments until desired flavor is achieved. Rye Malt is fully modified. It performs well in a single temperature infusion mash if used at less t

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Rye malt for rye style beers. Up to 50% may be used in some rye styles. Adds distinctive rye flavor and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a dry, crisp rye flavor to rye beers. Can be easier to mash than raw rye.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye, Flaked (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct in the total grist to create Rye Beer. Start at 5-10% and increase in increments of 5% because of the concentrated flavor of Rye Flakes.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Sinamar (Wyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A unique coloring agent in liquid form. Schwartz beer, colour adjustment.Roast malt beer extract.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malt that has been smoked over an open fire. Creates a distinctive "smoked" flavor and aroma. Used primarily for German Rauchbier but can also be added to Brown Ales and Porters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Smoked flavor and aroma base malt. Used in smoked ales, lagers and wheat beers, primarily German styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special B (Dingemans)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Special B (140°-155°L)darkest of the Belgian crystal malts,will impart a heavy caramel taste and is often credited with the raisin-like flavors of some Belgian Abbey ales.Larger %s(greater than 5%) will contribute a dark brown-black color and fuller body

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special B Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Extreme caramel aroma and flavored malt. Used in dark Belgian Abbey and Trappist ales. Unique flavor and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special Roast
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use for English ales, nut brown ales and porters. Adds a toasted, biscuit like flavor and aroma

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special Roast (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Toasty, Biscuity, Sour, Tangy COLOR: Deep Golden to Brown Hues Excellent for Nut Brown Ales, Porter and other dark beer styles. Special processing develops unique Toasty, Biscuity, Sour, Tangy flavors distinctive to Special Roast Malt .

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Sugar, Table (Sucrose)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: White table sugar, or sucrose primarily is used to increase alcohol. Using too much will add a cider flavor to beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Toasted Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Toasted malt can be made at home by toasting pale malted barley for 10-15 minutes at 350 F. Similar to Biscuit or Victory malt - this malt adds reddish/orange color and improved body without sweetness. Toasted flavor. Mashing required to avoid haze.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Treacle
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: UK mixture of molasses, invert sugar and golden (corn) syrup. Imparts an intense sweet flavor and dark color. Used in dark English ales. Also called "Black Treacle" or the brand name "Lyle's Black Treacle Syrup."

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Turbinado
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light, raw brown sugar. May be used in British pale ales or high gravity Belgian ales. Limit percentage used to avoid undesirable flavors. Similar to Demerara sugar.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Victory Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Toasted malt that adds a "Biscuit" or toasted flavor to English ales. Use for: Nut brown ales, porters

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Victory Malt (biscuit) (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Biscuity, Baking Bread, Nutty COLOR: Deep Golden to Brown Hues With an aroma of baking bread, Victory® Malt is great in Nut Brown Ales and other dark beers. Special processing develops the biscuity, baking bread, nutty flavors that are distinc

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Kiln dried malt darker than Pale Malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt Imparts a golden to orange color to the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Malty, Very Slight Biscuit Can be used as a base malt Use with Caramel Malts to produce malty red and amber beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Vienna base malt - used in many continental beer styles. Full bodied, golden color.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat - Red Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Creamy, Sweet, Malty, Wheat, Floury Imparts malty flavor not obtainable from raw wheat. Use with rice hulls to improve lautering and help prevent stuck mash. White Wheat Malt contributes to foam production and foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat - Soft Red, Flaked (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use up to 40% as a cereal adjunct in the total grist Use in the production of Belgian Wit Beers Use 0.5-1.0% to a standard brew to increase foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat - White Malt (Briess)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: FLAVOR: Creamy, Sweet, Malty, Wheat, Floury Imparts malty flavor not obtainable from raw wheat. Use with rice hulls to improve lautering and help prevent stuck mash. White Wheat Malt contributes to foam production and foam stability.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Wheat based dry extract for use in all wheat beers. Use as base or to increase gravity of any wheat beer. Examples: Weizen, weiss, wheat ales and lagers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unhopped Wheat liquid malt extract. Contains approx 60% Wheat, 40% Barley Use for Bavarian wheats, weizens, weiss and dunkel weizen styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Bel
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted wheat for use in Wheat beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Dark
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malted wheat base for use in dark wheat styles such as Dunkleweizen.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Dark (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Darker wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Ger
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted wheat base for use in all wheat styles

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt, Pale (Weyermann)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pale wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flaked wheat adds to increased body and foam retention Used in place of raw or torrified wheat for faster conversion and better yield. May be used in small amounts to improve head retention and body Examples: Belgian White beer, Wit

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Roasted
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Also called Chocolate Wheat Malt. Kilned raw wheat - adds a deep, dark brown color to dunkelweizens and other dark beer styles. Roasted, woody, charcoal or burnt toast flavor depending on degree of roasting.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Torrified
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unmodified wheat that has been "popped" to open the kernels Used primarily in place of raw wheat when making Belgian White and Wit Faster conversion and higher yield than raw wheat Protein rest recommended when mashing

FERMENTABLE.NAME: White Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: White wheat gives a malty flavor not available from raw wheat. Used in Weiss, Wit and White beers
